name: heat production, wood chips from post-consumer wood, at furnace 300kW | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23337/documentation

This inventory is based on a proxy due to lack of specific process data. This proxy is obtained from the dataset "heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW". The heat of combustion of chips from post-consumer wood is based on the low heating value of mixed wood chips and furnace efficiency.  The density is 188.6 kg dry mass/m3.;In reality this type of wood will produce additional emissions as opposed to natural wood, due to substances applied to wood during its lifetime. Therefore, the present inventory shall be considered as a rough estimation and should be revised when more reliable data is available. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.;Air emission factors as well as the boiler efficiency represent average annual operation including start and stop (warm-up and shut-down). Therefore, emission data will be higher and efficiency will be lower than rated values provided by manufacturers. The inventory shall be considered as being representative also for boilers with nominal capacities in the approximate range of 70 kW to 500 kW.

The activity starts with the arrival of wood chips from post-consumer wood in the furnace

Included are the infrastructure, the wood requirements (wood chips, from post-consumer wood), the emissions to air, the electricity needed for operation, and the disposal of the ashes.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Key emission factors PM, CO, NMVOC, CH4, NOx as well as the average annual efficiency have been updated using the latest available information. Other emission data are from the second half of the 1990Â´s.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: LCI data for Switzerland were used for the GLO activityy as first approximation with uncertainty factors adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Boiler of average technology available on the Swiss market.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
The numbers used in the mathematical relation refer to the input of one MJ of fuel with the heat output depending on the efficiency of the furnace. Using the "scling factor" (inverse of the efficiency) allows for scaling of the amount of the reference product to 1.
EcoSpold01Location=CH
